fifth month of the lunar calendar

low (rank, degree, value, content, quality, etc.)

red earth (i.e. containing cinnabar or minium)

to catch (a wild animal, fish, insect, baseball, etc.)

every (usu. with events, e.g. every weekend)
crossbow (incl. large models operated by a number of people)
toad (esp. the Japanese toad, Bufo japonicus)
to cool (e.g. from a high temperature to room temperature)
to play (a stringed or keyboard instrument)
pluralizing suffix (esp. for people and animals; formerly honorific)
to put something out of the way
to rain (or snow), keeping people indoors
the Monkey (ninth sign of the Chinese zodiac)
piece(s) of firewood (esp. chopped or split from logs)
soft, crumpled, unlacquered headwear (often worn by soldiers under their helmets from the Kamakura period onward)
stone wash basin found in Japanese gardens
to peek (through a keyhole, gap, etc.)
cat (esp. the domestic cat, Felis catus)
half-way up a slope or stairway
